body:
This deals with deeper issues which came up when trying to fix #1434.

Currently, a decorated method in a `cdef class` is only supported if the decorator does not change the meaning of the `self` argument. For example, when cythonizing this:
```
cdef object sm = staticmethod

cdef class A:
    @sm
    def fake_static_method():
        return 42
```
Cython complains:
```
Method fake_static_method has wrong number of arguments (0 declared, 1 or more expected)
```

I tried to fix this, but it is not easy since Cython first creates `fake_static_method` as a normal method and then adapts it. For arbitrary decorators to work, the only way would be for Cython to create a non-method function `fake_static_method` and then apply decorators on that.
title: Deal with arbitrary decorators in cdef classes
